name: Talk Morrissey 1
_source: speak;Morrissey;Ah, young Simon.{w}{br}I haven't seen you since you were a child, if my memory serves me.{w}{br}What brings you here?

s;Simon;Lord Morrissey, I'm hoping to restore our houses' alliance.{w}{br}I know you were close with my father, but the uprisings and monsters....{w}{br}They made it hard to visit as often as I'd like after his passing.

s;Morrissey;I see...{w}{br}Yes, with the so-called "New Dawn's" wanton destruction of the area,{w}{br}it makes sense that House Verstadt was preoccupied.{w}{br}I'm more than happy to rebuild our houses' relationship.{w}{br}But I must ask, why now?{w}{br}The monsters and rebels have only become more of an issue.{w}{br}I hate to pry, but something must have prompted you to come here.
s;Simon;You're right, of course.{w}{br}Well, part of this is because I... {w}need your help.
s;Simon;Those "New Dawn" thugs. {w}They attacked us at night.{w}{br}Their forces are much stronger than we expected...

s;Simon;The noble houses are in danger, Lord Morrissey.{w}{br}Few houses remain, especially east of the capital.{w}{br}And with the route to the capital held by New Dawn, we're cut off from the rest of the region.
s;Morrissey;I agree that this is quite dire.{w}{br}This is all quite a shame... the nobles' might has never been challenged to such a degree.

s;Morrissey;I am open to negotiating on this.{w}{br}And I do not mean to sound unwilling to help,{w}{br}we must stand together in times like these, after all.{w}{br}Yet, I cannot afford to spare troops now, with the area in such disarray.
s;Morrissey;But we'll speak more tomorrow. It grows late.{w}{br}You are welcome to stay here for the night.{w}{br}I will have my servants prepare chambers for you and your retainers.
